thread.title: Queensland weather: Severe storm warning issued for southeast | Gold Coast Bulletin
thread.title_full: Queensland weather: Severe storm warning issued for southeast | Gold Coast Bulletin

title: Queensland weather: Severe storm warning issued for southeast | Gold Coast Bulletin
text:
Queensland weather: Severe storm warning issued for southeast The Courier-Mail February 28, 2017 5:07pm 
UPDATE: THE Bureau of Meteorology has issued three severe storm warnings for parts of southeast Queensland. 
The warning, issued at 5.05pm, said severe thunderstorms were detected on the weather radar near the area south of Gympie, Amamoor and Peak Crossing and would affect people in parts of the Ipswich, Gympie, Logan, Lockyer Valley, Noosa and Brisbane City Council Areas. media_camera A storm brews over Springfield. Picture: Shelly Robertson 
“These thunderstorms are moving towards the north to northeast,” the Bureau said. “They are forecast to affect Pomona and the area south of Amberley by 5:35pm and Ipswich, Gympie and the area southeast of Gympie by 6:05pm. 
“Damaging winds, heavy rainfall that may lead to flash flooding and large hailstones are likely.”
